Deploy the parachute and enjoy the descent
83: Keep your eyes on the soccer ball
Start by dropping the ball to your dominant foot
Lift your dominant foot and tap the ball gently with your toes
As the ball starts coming down, use the top of your foot to tap it back up into the air
Keep your non-dominant foot close to the ball for support
Alternate between tapping the ball with the top of your foot and lifting it with your toes
Try to keep a consistent rhythm and control the height of the ball
Continue practicing to improve your juggling skills
84: Position the ball on the penalty spot.
Visualize your target (e.g., the corner of the net).
Take a few steps backward to create momentum for your kick.
Choose your preferred technique for kicking the ball (e.g., side-foot, laces, etc.).
Run towards the ball with steady strides.
Strike the ball firmly and accurately towards your desired target.
Observe the ball's trajectory and the goalkeeper's reaction.
85: Grip the still rings firmly with both hands.
Jump up and grab the rings, keeping your arms straight.
Engage your core muscles and shoulder girdle.
Lower your body into a straight hanging position.
Bend your knees and pull your legs up towards your chest.
Extend your legs back out and straighten your body.
Perform a controlled swing and build momentum.
Release the rings and dismount safely.
86: Prepare the sumo wrestling arena by marking the boundaries and ensuring a flat surface.
Gather the sumo wrestlers and assign them their respective sides of the arena.
Perform a ceremonial ritual to pay respect to the sport and build excitement.
Determine the order in which the wrestlers will compete.
Each wrestler enters the arena, making sure they are in proper attire and ready for the match.
The wrestlers take their starting positions and await the referee's signal to begin.
The match begins, and the wrestlers engage in a fierce but controlled struggle to force their opponent out of the ring or make them touch the ground with something other than the soles of their feet.
The match concludes when one wrestler successfully defeats the other, and the winner is declared.
87: Paddle out past the breaking waves
Catch the wave and ride it towards the shore
88: Hold the golf club with both hands at the grip
Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart
Rotate your torso to the right (for right-handed golfers)
Keep your eye on the ball
Swing the club back, keeping your arms straight
Shift your weight onto your back foot
Swing the club forward, pivoting your hips and rotating your torso
89: Position yourself in front of the table.
Hold the table tennis racket with your dominant hand.
Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart.
Focus on the ball and track its movement.
Bend your knees slightly and prepare to swing.
Swing your arm forward in a smooth motion.
Make contact with the ball using the racket.
Follow through with your swing and return to the ready position.
90: Shift your weight to your left leg
Raise your right arm up and extend it forward
Rotate your body to the right as you shift your weight to your right leg
Bring your left arm across your body and extend it forward
Rotate your body to the left as you shift your weight to your left leg
Repeat the sequence with the opposite limbs
91: Hold the tennis racket with both hands, placing your dominant hand in the lower grip and your non-dominant hand in the upper grip.
Stand sideways to the net with your feet shoulder-width apart and your knees slightly bent.
Begin the swing by turning your shoulders, hips, and feet in the same direction, rotating your body towards the non-dominant side.
As you rotate, bring the racket back with your dominant hand, positioning it slightly above and behind your shoulder.
Initiate the forward swing by pushing off the ground with your back foot and transferring your weight onto your front foot.
Simultaneously, swing the racket forward and across your body, making contact with the ball at the optimal impact point.
Follow through with the swing by extending your arms and rotating your body fully towards the non-dominant side.
Finish the swing with a natural wrist snap, allowing the racket to follow a smooth and controlled path.
92: Grip the discus firmly in your throwing hand
Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart
Shift your weight to your back foot
Rotate your body towards the throwing area
Transfer your weight to your front foot
Release the discus at the appropriate time
Follow through with your arm and body
Observe the direction and distance of your throw
93: Warm up your body and stretch your muscles.
Position yourself in front of the trampoline with your feet shoulder-width apart.
Bend your knees and lower your body into a squatting position.
Swing your arms down and use them to propel yourself upwards.
Jump off both feet and onto the trampoline surface.
As you descend, bend your knees slightly to absorb the impact.
Push off the trampoline with your feet to jump back up.
Repeat the process to continue jumping on the trampoline.

Practice regularly to improve your typing speed and accuracy

Contact the ball at the highest point
Direct the ball towards your desired target
Follow through with your arm swing
Land on both feet and prepare for the next play
98: Stand with your feet hip-width apart and about a foot away from the wall.
Place your palms flat against the wall at shoulder height, slightly wider than your shoulders.
Engage your core and maintain a straight line from head to heels.
Bend your elbows and lower your chest towards the wall, keeping your body straight.
Push back up to the starting position, fully extending your arms.
Repeat the movement for the desired number of repetitions.
Rest and recover before performing another set.

100: Hold the YoYo with your dominant hand.
Extend your arm fully, making sure there is enough space for the YoYo to swing freely.
With a flick of the wrist, release the YoYo downwards.
Allow the YoYo to unwind and drop towards the ground.
At the bottom of the YoYo's swing, pull your wrist back slightly to start the YoYo climbing back up.
As the YoYo climbs back up, use your wrist to add some spin to the YoYo.
Catch the YoYo in your hand when it reaches the top.
Repeat the steps to continue playing with the YoYo.
